title: Two sisters found dead in Jodhpur on wedding eve; no suicide note recovered
content: Two sisters, Shobha (25) and Vimla (23), were found dead at their Jodhpur home on Friday, just a day before their scheduled weddings.  They were rushed to a hospital around 4 am after their health suddenly deteriorated, but were declared dead on arrival. Preliminary investigations suggest poisoning, with the post-mortem report to confirm the exact cause.

title: 'Imperils Republic's image': Delhi court blasts Congress' 'shirtless' protest at AI Summit
content: A Delhi court has remanded four Indian Youth Congress workers to five-day police custody, deeming their protest at the AI Impact Summit-2026 a "blatant assault on public order" that harmed India's diplomatic image. The activists wore provocative T-shirts, chanted slogans, and assaulted police personnel, raising concerns about potential external conspiracies and absconding associates.

title: Iran-US tensions: Tehran takes Hezbollah's reins, 'week' away from having bomb-grade uranium
content: US envoy Steve Witkoff warns Iran could be a week from producing bomb-grade uranium, despite past strikes.  Washington remains concerned about Tehran's nuclear ambitions, with US President Donald Trump demanding "zero enrichment" but reportedly considering limited, verifiable civilian enrichment. Domestic protests in Iran are also a factor in US policy.

title: Did OpenAI CEO just tell Pichai, Bezos & Musk that their 'space plans' are wrong?
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has labelled space data centres "ridiculous," citing prohibitive launch costs and unresolved cooling challenges.  Despite ambitious plans from Elon Musk, Google, and Jeff Bezos, Altman believes orbital computing won't be viable this decade.  He suggests the economics simply don't add up for now, though acknowledges future potential.

title: 'Nation knows your true form': PM Modi shreds Cong's 'dirty, naked politics' at AI event
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized the Congress party for its "shirtless" protest at the AI Impact Summit, calling it "dirty and shameless" politics. The protest by Indian Youth Congress workers, who wore T-shirts with the slogan "India-US Trade Deal Compromised," drew widespread condemnation, including from allies. Four IYC workers were sent to police custody.

title: FBI warns of ATM jackpotting incidents across US: What are they, how they work
content: Cybercriminals are increasingly targeting ATMs with 'jackpotting' malware, forcing machines to dispense cash without legitimate transactions. The FBI warns of a surge in these attacks, with significant financial losses reported. Threat actors exploit physical and software vulnerabilities, bypassing security to gain direct control and trigger rapid cash withdrawals, often leaving ATMs unexpectedly out of service.

title: Fasting during Ramadan: Experts suggest how people with diabetes can manage fasting window
content: Ramadan fasting can be a feasible option for many people living with diabetes, but it demands detailed planning, guidance from a healthcare professional, and vigilant monitoring. Specialists recommend altering medication schedules, opting for slow-release foods during Suhoor, and maintaining portion control during Iftar.

title: I came in search of jinns, but the haunting was disappointing: A tale from Delhi’s Jamali Kamali
content: A travel writer ventured to Delhi's Jamali Kamali Mosque and Tomb, drawn by tales of hauntings. Instead of spectral encounters, the writer found a serene, historically rich monument marred by modern vandalism. The experience revealed a profound human element, with the silence and beauty overshadowing any supernatural whispers, prompting reflection on how history is misinterpreted.

title: What is Anthropic's new AI tool that wiped off billions from cybersecurity stocks
content: Anthropic's new AI tool, Claude Code Security, scans for code vulnerabilities, prompting a multi-billion dollar stock market crash in the cybersecurity sector. While existing scanners use pattern matching, this AI reasons like a human researcher, identifying complex flaws. Despite its research preview status and human oversight requirement for fixes, the market reacted sharply to the potential disruption.

title: 'Don’t think PCB chief has given full freedom': Mohsin Naqvi under fire
content: Manoj Tiwary criticised PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, saying a lack of clarity and freedom may be causing tension between Pakistan’s coach and captain after Salman Agha’s bottle-throwing incident. He claimed it showed a trust deficit in the team setup. However, coach Mike Hesson dismissed rift rumours, saying Agha was frustrated with his own dismissal and the discussion was about batting plans, not an argument.

title: 'Teach them a lesson': Karni Sena warns filmmakers over films ‘targeting’ Sanatan Dharma
content: Kshatriya Karni Sena chief Raj Shekhawat issued a stern warning to filmmakers, threatening to confront them at their homes in Mumbai over movies allegedly targeting "Sanatan Dharma" and hurting religious sentiments. The group specifically objected to "Yadav Ji Ki Love Story" and "Ghooskhor Pandat," accusing filmmakers of disrespecting faith and social groups.

title: KC-390 Millennium: Embraer pitches Nato favorite for IAF deal, eyes India production hub
content: Brazilian firm Embraer is vying for a major Indian Air Force contract, proposing its KC-390 Millennium as the superior choice for around 80 medium transport aircraft. The company plans to establish India as its Asia-Pacific production hub if selected, highlighting the jet-powered aircraft's speed, payload, and operational cost advantages over competitors like the C-130J.

title: Matthew Tkachuk denies ‘psychological warfare’ claims vs Sidney Crosby
content: Matthew Tkachuk made it clear Team USA will not rely on mind games against Sidney Crosby ahead of the Olympic gold medal clash with Canada. Instead, the Americans are leaning on discipline, depth, and belief after a strong semifinal win. With Crosby’s status uncertain and Canada still dangerous, the final will test Team USA’s composure and championship readiness.

title: Who is Pernille Døsvik? Inside Johannes Klæbo’s fiancée and love story
content: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo is one of the biggest stars in winter sports. The Norwegian cross-country skier has dominated the Olympics and World Cup circuit for years. Off the snow, his personal life has also drawn attention. Klæbo is engaged to Pernille Døsvik, a young professional from Trondheim. The couple confirmed their engagement in June 2025 after several years together. Fans often see her supporting him during competitions and training periods.

title: Connor McDavid and wife Lauren Kyle McDavid combined net worth 2026
content: The success of the professional career of Connor McDavid and his wife, Lauren Kyle McDavid, is reflected in the financial empire they have created. Whether it is McDavid and his lucrative Edmonton Oilers contract and endorsement book or the growing design and hospitality businesses of Lauren, the two have a combined net worth in 2026 that can be seen as a wise investment, brand strength and long-term excellence on and off the ice.

title: 'Russia suffering 1,000 casualties per day, 80% from drones': Sunak after meeting Zelenskyy
content: Drones have become the defining weapon of the conflict, fundamentally reshaping how battles are fought. Defence analysts note that relatively cheap unmanned systems can now destroy extremely expensive targets such as tanks, ships and strategic bombers at a fraction of the cost. A recent Sunday Times defence analysis highlighted how Ukrainian drone strikes have destroyed high-value Russian military assets deep inside its territory, exposing vulnerabilities once thought impossible to exploit.

title: Hardik Pandya gifts ex-wife Natasa a luxury car worth Rs 4 crore, poses with son Agastya - PICS
content: Hardik Pandya and ex-wife Natasa Stankovic continue to co-parent son Agastya with maturity. He recently gifted her a black Land Rover Defender worth around Rs 4 crore. Natasa posed happily with Agastya and the SUV, while Hardik also moves ahead with his new relationship with Mahieka Sharma.

title: ‘Will not suffer any harm’: Congress plays down Bhupen Borah's BJP switch ahead of Assam polls
content: Assam's Opposition Leader Debabrata Saikia downplayed former state Congress chief Bhupen Kumar Borah's defection to the BJP, stating it won't impact upcoming elections. Saikia highlighted that local Congress leaders and workers from Borah's constituency remain loyal, assuring no significant harm to the party's prospects. Borah, after 32 years with Congress, officially joined the BJP on Sunday.

title: Nearly 300 drones, 50 missiles: Russia unleashes massive overnight assault on Ukraine
content: Russia unleashed a massive overnight missile and drone assault across Ukraine, claiming one life in the Kyiv region and damaging southern energy infrastructure. Ukrainian forces reported intercepting a significant portion of the incoming projectiles. Meanwhile, a separate explosion in Lviv resulted in one fatality and multiple injuries, with authorities stating it was unrelated to the Russian attacks.

title: 'Babar has found himself a little bit behind': Pak star’s struggles explained
content: Babar Azam has struggled in the T20 World Cup, scoring 66 runs in four matches and being moved to the middle order. Faf du Plessis supported coach Mike Hesson’s decision, saying modern T20 cricket demands much higher strike rates in the powerplay. He added Babar still has value on slower pitches in the middle overs. Pakistan next face England in a crucial Super 8 match.

title: 'So it's a loss then?': Moment Trump learnt of US top court's tariff blow mid-meeting
content: Supreme Court dealt a significant blow to President Trump's global tariff policy, striking it down in a 6-3 decision. Trump, reportedly seething, called the ruling a "disgrace" and "unpatriotic," criticizing even his own appointees. This marks a major policy reversal for the administration, potentially forcing a new legal strategy for future tariffs.

title: From Rafale to Tejas: IAF gears up for full-spectrum air power display at Vayushakti-26
content: The Indian Air Force will conduct Exercise Vayushakti-26 on February 27, 2026, at Pokhran to showcase its operational capabilities, including long-range precision strikes and multi-domain operations. The exercise will highlight indigenous platforms and the IAF's role as a first responder, demonstrating its ability to win future conflicts and reinforce national security.

title: Indian Coast Guard detains Iranian-crewed vessel; smuggled cigarettes worth crores seized
content: The Indian Coast Guard has intercepted a suspicious foreign vessel inside India’s Exclusive Economic Zone, around 115 nautical miles west of Dwarka. The boat, identified as Al Mukhtar, had four Iranian crew members and was found carrying 200 cartons of smuggled foreign-brand cigarettes. The vessel has been taken into custody.

title: Dalal Street watch: What to expect on Monday as Trump raises tariffs to 15%
content: Dalal Street faces renewed uncertainty as US President Trump increased global import tariffs to 15%, just after the Supreme Court struck down his earlier program. Investors are concerned about the unpredictability of trade tensions, despite expectations that the current rate may be temporary. This development adds to existing pressures on Indian equities from Fed policy and weak IT stocks.

title: Rajpal Yadav credits wife Radha for standing by him during cheque bounce case
content: Following his release from Tihar Jail on interim bail, veteran actor Rajpal Yadav has broken his silence regarding his ongoing legal battle. The comedian, who secured temporary relief in a cheque bounce case after depositing Rs 1.5 crore, expressed profound gratitude to the film fraternity and fans for their support during this challenging period. Ahead of his next court hearing on March 18, 2026, Yadav specifically highlighted  the vital role of his wife, Radha, in anchoring their family. While adhering to court conditions, including the surrender of his passport, the actor has promised a comprehensive press conference to provide legal context and finally present "his side of the story" to the public.

title: 'Dangerous tactic': Ex-India cricketer questions Surya's slow scoring rate
content: Sanjay Manjrekar has voiced concerns over Suryakumar Yadav's cautious batting approach in the T20 World Cup, suggesting it hinders finishers like Hardik Pandya. While acknowledging Suryakumar's adaptability against the USA, Manjrekar believes the captain has since become overly conservative, potentially risking India's scoring potential, especially when setting or chasing large totals.

title: PM Modi flags off India’s fastest metro and Namo Bharat RRTS — routes, speed and benefits explained
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the Meerut Metro and Namo Bharat services in Uttar Pradesh, dedicating development works worth Rs 12,930 crore. The 82 km Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat Corridor, designed for speeds up to 180 kmph, enhances regional connectivity. The Meerut Metro, operating on the same infrastructure, is set to become India's fastest metro network.

title: Red Fort, temples on radar? 8 suspects with Bangladesh, Pak links held for plotting terror attack
content: Eight individuals with alleged links to Pakistan's ISI and Bangladesh-based extremist groups were apprehended in Tamil Nadu and West Bengal. Intelligence reports indicated a potential terror plot targeting Delhi's Red Fort and prominent temples. The arrests followed specific inputs about a module planning subversive activities, with digital materials being analyzed to uncover a wider network.

title: 'Mom, he will kill me today': Mother recalls chilling last call in Tripura teen assault case
content: A 19-year-old student from Tripura was allegedly confined, assaulted, and raped by her live-in partner in Gurugram. Her mother and lawyer claim she endured prolonged torture, including being burned and cut, with attempts on her life. Police are investigating the serious allegations.

title: Brother vs brother as Morne Morkel and Albie Morkel split loyalties in IND vs SA clash
content: Brothers Morne and Albie Morkel will face off as rival coaches in the T20 World Cup Super 8 clash between India and South Africa. Morne coaches India's bowling attack, while Albie serves as a consultant for South Africa, both aiming for victory despite their family ties. Their childhood backyard rivalries are now amplified on the international stage.

title: Can’t afford that flight ticket today? Jazeera Airways says 'fly now, pay later'
content: Jazeera Airways has launched a groundbreaking 'Fly Now, Pay Later' option, becoming the first Kuwaiti airline to offer interest-free installment payments for flights. This strategic partnership with deema aims to enhance travel affordability and accessibility for a wider range of passengers. The move signifies a significant step in the region's digital aviation transformation.

title: IDFC First Bank reports Rs 590 crore fraud in Haryana government accounts
content: IDFC First Bank reported a Rs 590 crore discrepancy in Haryana government deposits at its Chandigarh branch, suspending four employees. The bank has initiated a forensic audit and is working with other banks to recover funds. This disclosure follows Haryana's directive for departments to close accounts with specific private lenders due to suspected financial irregularities.

title: RBI’s new data centre far from seismic risks and cross-border threats — where is it?
content: The Reserve Bank of India has established a high-security data center in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, to protect critical financial systems. This strategic location minimizes exposure to cross-border threats and seismic risks, ensuring operational continuity. The facility supports core banking functions and enhances the safety and resilience of India's financial infrastructure.

title: 'Abki baar Trump se haar': Congress targets Centre over Trump tariffs
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh attacked the Centre over the proposed India-US interim trade pact, calling it “Abki baar Trump se haar” and demanding it be put in cold storage and renegotiated. He warned agri import liberalisation would hurt farmers across states and questioned the deal’s timing amid US tariff turmoil after a Supreme Court ruling against Donald Trump’s earlier measures.

title: Ex-CIA agent claims US has decided on imminent strike against Iran
content: Former CIA officer John Kiriakou claimed the US has decided to launch military strikes on Iran within days, citing a source who visited the White House. He said internal divisions exist, with JD Vance and Tulsi Gabbard opposing action, while Marco Rubio backs it, as US forces reposition across the Middle East.

title: ‘Why now?’: Gavaskar questions timing of Super 8 pre-seeding row at T20 World Cup
content: Fans are criticising the T20 World Cup's pre-seeding format, which placed strong group winners in the same Super 8 group. However, batting legend Sunil Gavaskar questioned the timing of this outrage, suggesting logistical complexities for the ICC in a multi-country tournament. He highlighted international travel and accommodation as potential reasons for advance group assignments.

title: ‘Problem lies in…’: Irfan Pathan reveals how Abhishek Sharma can break free from slump
content: Former all-rounder Irfan Pathan has advised T20 World Cup opener Abhishek Sharma to adjust his shot selection against off-spinners, urging him to settle in before attacking. Pathan highlighted Abhishek's tendency to play across the wicket too early. He also praised Ishan Kishan's current form but cautioned about his approach against wide deliveries.

title: M.V. Govindan says no one will be shielded in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Conclusions can be drawn only after the SIT completes investigation, says CPI(M) State secretary. He criticises ‘selective outrage’ and claims there was no discussion when allegation was raised against Congress leader

title: Bengaluru civic bodies mull stricter target-based surgeries, accountability to strengthen ABC programme
content: The move comes even as the city corporations are scouting locations to set up shelters and new ABC centres to comply with Supreme Court directives requiring them to relocate dogs living within institutions (both private and government) to shelters.

title: 2 new rapid rail corridors originating from Sarai Kale Khan expected soon: Khattar
content: The Sarai Kale Khan station, inaugurated virtually by Prime Minister Narendra Modi from Meerut, will serve as a major interchange for the Delhi-Meerut RRTS and future rapid rail corridors

title: We believe Siddaramaiah will continue as CM, says Satish Jarkiholi
content: Mr. Jarkiholi clarified that his recent trip to New Delhi was not to rally support for Mr. Siddaramaiah or any other leader.

title: Stage set for elections to 48 civic bodies in Jharkhand
content: “The elections are scheduled to be held for the posts of mayor, chairperson and councillor at 1,042 wards in nine municipal corporations, 20 nagar parishads and 19 nagar panchayats,” Jharkhand SEC secretary said

title: Bangalore University’s PhD notification opposed by faculty, student organisations
content: Students have urged the University to drop internal reservation for PhD admission from the recent notification and re-notify it as the case is still pending in the High Court.

title: Kerala Infrastructure and Technology for Education extends support to Tamil and Kannada students through content development
content: KITE integrates Tamil and Kannada language content into educational entertainment free software GCompris

title: Security agencies alert on illegal use of satellite phones in Indian waters
content: Crew using banned portable satellite communication systems pose threat to national security and maritime safety, says the DGS

title: Public open universities’ V-C’s round table conference in Thiruvananthapuram from February 23
content: Key objectives of the meet include developing a credit transfer framework among open universities, leveraging digital technologies to modernise pedagogy, democratising access to higher education, promoting effective use of Artificial Intelligence in distance education and increasing learner enrolment

title: T.N. Assembly election: DMK will disprove claim that it can’t win consecutive term, says CPI(M) leader Shanmugam
content: P. Shanmugam said the CPI(M), which has been invited for seat-sharing talks on February 26, would seek a two-digit number of seats.

title: Opposition to boycott Fadnavis Government's high tea invite, says Jadhav; cites Indo-U.S. deal, Pawar's death
content: Mr. Jadhav said another reason for the Opposition to decline the invite was due to the Maharashtra Government’s “ambiguous stand” on the death of Ajit Pawar in a plane accident

title: Partially burnt body of 27-year-old businessman found near Himayathsagar in Telangana
content: The deceased is identified as Amir, a resident of Tolichowki, with police teams shifting the body for postmortem examination and launching an investigation into the incident

title: Congress unveils initiatives to provide legal aid to party members at grassroots level, engage with youths
content: The first such initiative is a Congress legal fellows programme for helping bring into the party mainstream young lawyers by giving them a key role in the law-making process, Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi says.

title: Two policemen found dead at border outpost in Gurdaspur, Punjab
content: According to the police, the deceased were identified as Gurnam Singh and Ashok Kumar, who were posted at an outpost in Adhian in Punjab's Gurdaspur district

title: Kerala sanctions ₹10.28 crore for renovation of four roads in Kozhikode
content: Public Works Minister P.A. Mohamed Riyas said that funds had been allocated for road repair works in Kozhikode North, Beypore, Elathur and Kuttiadi Assembly constituencies

title: Durai Vaiko seeks operation of shuttle services between Tiruchi and Salem
content: Requests for halt of Tiruchi - Mayiladuthurai MEMU express at Tiruverumbur to enhance passenger patronage

title: APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University approves ₹372.51-crore budget for 2026–27; thrust on social impact and AgriTech innovation
content: Allocations prioritise comprehensive development initiatives aimed at strengthening infrastructure, enhancing the research ecosystem, and accelerating digital transformation across the university

title: Archives at NCBS to launch 80,000 plus new archival objects in Bengaluru
content: The Archives at NCBS is a public centre for the history of science in contemporary India and the event will be held at the Dasheri auditorium in the NCBS campus.

title: Rapid rail services to reduce travel time between Meerut, Delhi to around 40-45 minutes: U.P. CM
content: Mr. Adityanath said the Prime Minister's regular review of infrastructure projects has helped fast-track projects worth ₹85 lakh crore that had remained pending for decades

title: Congress seeks to implicate CMO in ‘wrongful arrest’ of Tantri in the Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Senior Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala said the Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan’s office (CMO) had scapegoated the Tantri to insulate former and present Devaswom Ministers, as well as the former Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB) president, P S Prasanth, from prosecution

title: Two sisters found dead on their wedding day in Rajasthan’s Jodhpur
content: The exact cause of death will be confirmed after the post-mortem report is completed, says the Police

title: Tiger moved to bigger enclosure in Mukundra Hills Tiger Reserve as part of rewilding plan
content: MT-7 tiger was tranquilised, radio-collared and shifted to a larger 21-hectare enclosure for further monitoring and adaptation, with her movements being closely monitored

title: MSME park proposed on outskirts of Vizianagaram, says Collector
content: Land has been identified for the development of the MSME park, which would have all the facilities, including a dedicated water supply, electricity, internal roads and others, the District Collector said

title: ‘Jai Hanuman’ goes on floors: Rishab Shetty begins shoot for Prasanth Varma’s mythological epic
content: Produced by Mythri Movie Makers and T-Series, the pan-India film was launched with a traditional ceremony at Anjanadri Betta in Karnataka

title: PM Modi pays tributes to Jayalalithaa, hails her welfare work for women of Tamil Nadu
content: In his monthly radio broadcast Mann Ki Baat, Mr. Modi said just a mention of "Amma" — as Jayalalithaa was often called — brings a glow to the faces of the people of Tamil Nadu

title: Two-wheeler industry to grow at 8-9% Compound Annual Growth Rate in long term: TVS Motor CEO
content: K.N. Radhakrishnan made the statement, drawing from the momentum of the GST rate cut, the government’s infrastructure spending, and the overall growth of the economy

title: Milind Soman leads Hill Highway Run in Idukki
content: The 40.05-kilometer Idukki hill highway project was funded by an administrative sanction from Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board; completed in phases, the stretch from Kuttikkanam to Kattappana is now fully operational

title: Luxury car crashes after alleged brake failure in Jubilee Hills
content: A red Ferrari crashed into an electric pole, swerved across the road, and collided head-on with three vehicles near actor Nandamuri Balakrishna’s residence

title: Coal demand set for uptick on rising power needs: expert
content: Country's coal sector is staring at a surprise demand slowdown, forcing major public firms and new commercial miners to rethink expansion plans amid rising uncertainties

title: Firing heard outside BHU hostel; case registered against three individuals
content: Following the incident, students recovered empty shell casings from the spot and handed them over to the police; police said that they have registered a case against three individuals allegedly involved in the incident

title: T.N. Assembly election: DMK begins seat-sharing talks with allies, Congress leader K.C. Venugopal to meet Stalin
content: On February 22, the DMK’s seat-sharing committee began talks with leaders of the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) at ‘Anna Arivalayam’. The IUML, which was allotted three seats in the 2021 Assembly elections, has now requested five seats.

title: U.S. trade deal proof of ‘Abki baar Trump se haar’: Congress’ swipe at government
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said an agreement is about give and take but India had only given under the interim trade pact

title: PM Modi flags off Meerut Metro, Namo Bharat train
content: Namo Bharat, India’s first regional rapid transit system, will connect Sahibabad, Ghaziabad, Modinagar, and Meerut to Delhi at a design speed of 180 km/h

title: Over 840 job openings in coastal Karnataka are on offer under ‘HomeComing’ platform, says Silicon Beach Programme
content: Experienced-level IT roles are on offer from 100 + companies across Udupi-Mangaluru region and the SBP has already facilitated 16 successful senior hires, says Rohith Bhat, convener, SBP

title: IDFC FIRST Bank discloses ₹590 crore fraud at Chandigarh branch
content: The bank said it received a request from a particular Department of Haryana Government for closure of its account and transfer of funds to another bank

title: Human Rights Commission launches investigation into newborn’s death in Kerala hospital
content: The family alleged that the doctor failed to communicated the possibility of complications and claimed that prolonging the labour and failing to conduct the C-section in a timely manner had led to the death

title: Telangana BJP chief Ramchander Rao arrested, prevented from going to ‘tense’ Kamareddy
content: The BJP leader was kept under house arrest to foil his attempts to go to Kamareddy and later Banswara

title: Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat & Meerut Metro launch: full route, fares, and timings explained
content: The Prime Minister will dedicate the entire 82 km Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat Corridor, which is designed to provide high-speed, high-frequency connectivity between Delhi and Meerut

title: Maoists general secretary reportedly surrenders before Telangana police
content: Devji is believed to have taken over as the Maoist general secretary after the encounter of Nambala Keshava Rao

title: Maan ki Baat: PM Modi urges citizens to ‘be alert against digital arrest scams’
content: Prime Minister said “At AI Impact Summit, world leaders were impressed by AI breakthroughs in treatment of animals and 24x7 help to farmers”

title: Woman brutally assaulted by live-in partner in Gurugram, FIR registered
content: The FIR, registered based on the victim’s statement, states that Shivam was having a physical relationship with her under the pretext of marriage, thrashing her and subjecting her to violence

title: Woman dies in elephant attack in Chikkamagaluru, second death in six days
content: Even as the locals staged a protest, the Forest Department staff sedated a tusker said to be responsible for the two deaths, near Beranagodu in Chikkamagaluru taluk.

title: Victoria student’s hostel in Chennai: regal, but in need of attention
content: The hostel, coming under the Presidency College, stands on what was once called Chepauk Park, a triangular stretch of land on the west bank of the canal behind Presidency College

title: In Frames: Unearthing the silent splendour of Hoysalas
content: In the rural parts of Hassan, Mandya and Mysuru in Karnataka, overlooked Hoysala-era temples and basadis reveal a thriving medieval kingdom’s devotion and sculptural mastery; through star-shaped platforms, serene shrines, finely sculpted pillars and quiet stepwells, the Hoysala imagination continues to whisper through stone

title: Five police personnel die in head-on collision between their vehicle and truck in Odisha
content: Five cops died, and three others sustained severe injuries in the deadly collision, in Jharsuguda district on February 22

title: Uttarakhand CM approves action against ineligible beneficiaries drawing dual pensions
content: The direction came on February 21, 2026 after a recent data analysis by the CAG related to government pensions in Uttarakhand uncovered alleged irregularities, revealing that 1,377 people in the State were receiving double pension benefits

title: Palaniswami assures people of bringing back hawala money stashed abroad in the event of victory
content: Palaniswami alleged that the ruling DMK had “appropriated” all the additional revenue earned by the State government and the “hawala’ money had been  placed abroad

title: Why has eastern Nagaland got autonomy? | Explained
content: What does the Frontier Nagaland Territorial Authority offer to six ‘backward’ districts of the State?

title: St. Xavier’s University, Kolkata confers D.Litt on Shashi Tharoor at seventh convocation
content: Authorities of St Xavier’s University announced a number of new academic programmes including B. Tech degree course from 2026.  The convocation ceremony saw degrees being awarded to 1052 postgraduate and undergraduate students and 25 Ph.D scholars

title: Why has NGT cleared the Nicobar project? | Explained
content: Why does the government insist that the project is of strategic importance? What will India achieve by establishing a major cargo transshipment hub? What will happen to the biodiversity of the Great Nicobar Island? What are the concerns? Can coral colonies be translocated?

title: Akhilesh questions removal of NSG cover, accuses BJP government of 'playing' with his security
content: "The BJP government is playing with my security. I had NSG security, but it was withdrawn. The government should have disclosed why," Akhilesh Yadav said, alleging that security decisions were being politicised.

title: Five school teachers held in Odisha for 'raping' 13-year-old girl
content: The arrests were made after the father of the class 7 student and the district child welfare committee lodged separate complaints at the Rajkanika police station, alleging that the accused teachers had raped the minor, a senior officer said.

title: IED recovered behind police post in Amritsar
content: Police said the improvised explosive device (IED) was later defused, and an FIR was registered at the Beas police station. An investigation is underway, they added.

title: Estranged CPI(M) leader Pratikur Rahaman joins Trinamool Congress
content: Pratikur Rahaman alleged that he was being sidelined within the party and pointed fingers at CPI(M) State Secretary Md. Salim

title: Omar Abdullah pleads with Delhi to keep beating ordinary Kashmiri youth: J&K LoP Sunil Sharma
content: The LoP said around 23,000 jobs were outsourced in J&K. “This decision has shattered the dreams of thousands of unemployed youth and amounts to a betrayal,” he added.

title: Actor Mammootty meets landslide survivor
content: Sandhya, who sustained injuries in the landslide, recently underwent a surgery at the hospital to fit the artificial limb

title: Farm politics intensifies in west U.P. over India-U.S. deal
content: BKU’s Tikait faction seeks clarity from the govt. on the impact of the trade deal on farmers, takes on Jayant Chaudhary; concerns unfounded: RLD; khaps discuss direct and indirect impact of deal

title: How SimpleGov initiative is simplifying processes for government services
content: These simplification efforts, however, were far from simple as several Acts and government orders had to be amended accordingly to facilitate the process

title: India set to emerge as world’s third-largest economy: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi
content: The Minister says that after the United States, the United Kingdom, and China, India is making significant strides in the academic sphere

title: Former Speaker P. Dhanapal’s son joins TVK in Chennai
content: According to TVK sources, Cathrine Ezhilmalai, former Union Minister Dalit Ezhilmalai’s daughter, and Chakkaravarthy, freedom fighter Immanuel Sekaran’s grandson, have also joined the party

title: Thai University confers honorary doctorate to VIT vice-president in Vellore
content: The honorary degree symbolises the highest level of academic recognition bestowed by the institution for distinguished service and professional excellence

title: Ramalinga Reddy opens Living Spaces 2026, The Hindu Group’s annual realty expo
content: IDBI Bank’s pan India home loan book size was ₹72,000 crore as on December 31, 2025. Mumbai accounted for the major chunk of these loans followed by Bengaluru with a share of ₹13,000 core, indicating a spurt in home sales

title: Kingston Engineering College near Katpadi becomes autonomous
content: D.M. Kathir Anand, college chairman and Vellore MP, urged the faculty members to continue their cooperation and collaboration in steering the college towards greater heights in its next phase of growth and development

title: Comparing separation of powers jurisprudence between India and U.S. based on recent SCOTUS ruling
content: The International Emergency Economic Powers Act’s half-century of existence has never witnessed the national emergency law being used by the Executive to such a distinct and sweeping extent

title: 900 police personnel to be deployed for TVK’s meeting in Vellore on February 23, says SP
content: For the Vellore event, the police restricted the total number of participants to 4,900 persons due to hot weather

title: Police seize 21 kg ganja at Katpadi railway station
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the suspect had bought ganja from drug peddlers in Andhra Pradesh to sell in retail to individuals and workers at key towns and industrial centres in the State

title: Estimates notwithstanding, T.N. government is hopeful of sticking to fiscal norms
content: Referring to the savings of about ₹5,710 crore in non-development expenditure, the government is optimistic about achieving the targets, which have, of course, been set in “the absence of new external fiscal challenges”

title: Corporators discuss summer preparedness in VMC council meeting
content: They call for steps to ensure clean and safe drinking water to residents, highlight supply of discoloured water in some areas, and stress the need to check mosquito menace; TDP and YSRCP members spar over progress of works under Nadu-Nedu

title: BJP holds nationwide demonstrations, political parties denounce Youth Congress protest at AI summit
content: The Congress party faces criticism from several quarters of the political spectrum for backing the ‘shirtless’ stir by Youth Congress workers at the India AI Impact Summit venue

title: Calcutta High Court cancels judicial officers’ leaves to assist SIR
content: All leave, except under medical emergency, granted earlier to any judicial officer, stands cancelled till March 9, and those already on leave were directed to join their respective courts and offices by February 23

title: Tech knowledge essential for comprehensive development, says H.K. Patil
content: Dr. Patil said the animal husbandry sector forms the backbone of the rural economy, and farmers’ income can be enhanced by adopting scientific methods, modern technology and animal welfare practices.

title: SIR: Thiruvananthapuram district has a little over 25.26 lakh voters
content: This number is 3.21 lakh lower compared to the October 27, 2025, list which had 28,47,907 voters, but higher by 86,083 voters compared to the draft electoral roll published on December 23, 2025

title: Need to recalibrate Union-State relations as centralisation has failed to deliver: M.K. Stalin
content: Tamil Nadu CM disseminates Part I of a report by the High-Level Committee on Union-State Relations, headed by Justice Kurian Joseph; says Centre must stay focused on national responsibilities, restore States’ autonomy

title: What we learned in Duke's win over Michigan
content: Duke is as good as any team, and all the ingredients that made Michigan a dominant squad weren't there.

title: Former Purdue, NFL receiver Moore dies at 25
content: Former Purdue and NFL wide receiver Rondale Moore died Saturday at the age of 25, according to the Minnesota Vikings.

title: Sources: Suns lose Brooks to broken left hand
content: Suns guard Dillon Brooks broke his left hand in Saturday's game against Orlando and is expected to miss an extended period of time, sources told ESPN.

title: McGregor teases return, open to fight 'no name'
content: In a social media post on Saturday, Conor McGregor, who is 22-6 but has been out of action since July 2021, once again teased the possibility of a return to competition, this time against a "no name" opponent, asking the UFC to "send the contract, lads."

title: Behind Boozer, No. 3 Duke stuns No. 1 Michigan
content: Cameron Boozer scored 18 points, and the No. 3 Duke Blue Devils handed another neutral-site loss to fellow blueblood Michigan, knocking off the top-ranked Wolverines 68-63 on Saturday in a raucous possible Final Four preview in the nation's capital.

title: Garcia wrests Barrios' WBC title in one-sided win
content: Ryan Garcia delivered perhaps the most complete performance of his career, dropping Mario Barrios early and cruising to a unaniomous decision to win the WBC welterweight title.

title: 'Wonder Woman' Gu claims 6th Olympic medal
content: Eileen Gu defended her Olympic ski halfpipe title on Sunday to make it six medals in six events over her Winter Games career.

title: Sources: Cowboys agree to deal with RB Williams
content: The Cowboys and free-agent-to-be running back Javonte Williams reached agreement on a three-year contract that includes $16 million in guaranteed money, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Saturday.

title: 🫧 Men's NCAA tournament Bubble Watch
content: The Bulldogs padded their NCAA tournament case with another key victory just days after beating Kentucky.

title: Women's Bracketology: Can red-hot Duke get to a No. 2 seed?
content: The Blue Devils have won 17 consecutive games. They're undefeated in ACC play. But they remain a 3-seed.

title: Mendoza, Reese, Tyson: NFL execs, scouts, players discuss the draft class elite
content: We asked NFL execs, scouts and players to weigh in on the Raiders' No. 1 pick and the best prospects in 2026.

title: Boxing is better when Ryan Garcia is on top of his game
content: The stakes have never been higher for Ryan Garcia, with Shakur Stevenson and Devin Haney waiting in the wings.

title: MLB.TV on ESPN: Subscription cost, game coverage, more facts
content: ESPN is the home of MLB.TV! Learn how to sign up for a subscription, watch your favorite games and take full advantage of this exciting product now.

title: Bridgeman on brink of first PGA title at Genesis
content: Jacob Bridgeman came out firing Saturday at Riviera and never let up until he had the low score of the day at 7-under 64 and a six-shot lead over Rory McIlroy in the Genesis Invitational.

title: How does an NFL player decide to retire? 'I'm not done'
content: Eric Weddle, Tony Jefferson and Andrew Whitworth share stories of their journeys in and out of retirement.

title: Messi struggles in MLS opener, will it impact his World Cup hopes?
content: Lionel Messi had a decent game in the 3-0 defeat to LAFC, but decent isn't what you expect from him, especially during a World Cup year.

title: College football's 100 best quarterbacks of the 2000s
content: Make way for Fernando Mendoza and others on Bill Connelly's updated list of the greatest quarterbacks of the century.

title: Four teams with pass-rush needs, four trade offers for Maxx Crosby: Our experts play out his market
content: Could edge rusher Maxx Crosby get traded this offseason? Where could he land? And what might the Raiders get for him? Let's project his market.

title: Who's the best second baseman in MLB? Buster Olney ranks the top 10
content: Does Marte's offense put him on top? Or does Hoerner's elite defense make him No. 1? Here's how our list shakes out.

title: Ranking the top 10 first basemen in MLB: Is Vlad Jr. or Kurtz No. 1?
content: Our top-10 rankings continue with a look at baseball's best first basemen, including the A's budding star.

title: After chaos of Amorim era, Carrick has brought calm to Man United
content: In stark contrast to the melodrama and tumult around his predecessor, Michael Carrick's steadying presence has put Manchester United on track to qualify for Europe.

title: MVP should book these fights on the Rousey vs. Carano card
content: Brock Lesnar and Anderson Silva back in MMA? Jake Paul could take the May 16 card over the top with names like that.

title: How Wemby and the Spurs turned things around one year after a devastating diagnosis
content: One year after a blood clot ended his season, Victor Wembanyama has the Spurs bound for the playoffs.

title: NBA MVP straw poll 2.0: SGA, Jokic lead our update -- but chaos looms
content: With so many contenders in danger of missing the 65-game threshold, this race could take a sharp turn.

title: Risers and fallers: Tristan Vukcevic, Jarace Walker making the most of playing time
content: Should fantasy basketball managers keep or trade players like Tristan Vukcevic, Pascal Siakam and others?

title: F1 predicted running order for 2026: Who is on top of the new cars?
content: With six days of testing in Bahrain now complete, ESPN pores over the data and speaks with paddock sources to predict F1's running order for 2026.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs, Newcastle eye former Liverpool striker Núñez
content: Tottenham Hotspur and Newcastle United are among the clubs interested in signing Al Hilal striker Darwin Núñez. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Top 50 USMNT players of 2026, ranked by club form: Which Americans made the top 10?
content: Who are the 50 best American players of 2026 so far? The top 10 sees a shake-up as the USMNT Player Performance Index returns.

title: Newlywed Couple Was On Way Home, Bride's Ex Lover Kidnaps Her At Gunpoint
content: A newly married woman was allegedly kidnapped at gunpoint by her former lover while returning home with her husband after their wedding ceremony early Sunday morning in Odisha's Bolangir district.

title: How Nearly 20,000 ISIS-Linked Individuals Vanished In Syria Security Collapse
content: About 15,000 to 20,000 people have escaped from Syria's Al-Hol camp, according to US intelligence agencies.

title: 16 SIMs, 8 Phones, 1 Deadly Plot: How Pak-Backed Terror Plot Was Busted
content: The Delhi Police's Special Cell foiled a major terrorist plot in an operation that lasted 10 days. They busted a terror module linked to Pakistan's Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and arrested eight suspects. Seven of them are Bangladeshi nationals.

title: Battle For Purvanchal Votes: Haryana Chief Minister To Campaign In Ludhiana
content: As political activity begins to gather pace ahead of the 2027 Punjab assembly election, the BJP is sharpening its outreach to migrant voters -- particularly the sizeable Purvanchali community settled across the state's industrial towns.

title: 'Congress Has No Funds To Contest Assam Polls': Ex State Chief Joins BJP
content: The Congress's Assam leadership knows it is going to lose the upcoming Assembly polls and does not even have funds to contest the election, former state Congress chief Bhupen Borah told NDTV right after joining the BJP today.

title: 2 Terrorists Killed In Major Op In J&K's Kishtwar, 2 AK-47 Rifles Recovered
content: Two terrorists have been killed in an ongoing operation by security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Sunday, officials said.

title: Trump Was In A Meeting During Top Court Tariff Setback. How He Reacted
content: The Supreme Court of the United States struck down Trump's global tariff programme, ruling that he overstepped his authority in imposing the trade measures.

title: While Big Corporations Stayed Quiet, 1 Wine Merchant Took On Trump Tariffs
content: Victor Schwartz keeps a bottle of Chateauneuf-du-Pape for special occasions. On Friday, he finally opened it. Not because of a vintage milestone, but because he beat the President of the United States in court.

title: After Andhra, Karnataka Considers Smartphone Curbs for Students Under 16
content: The Karnataka government is actively considering a proposal to restrict mobile phone use for students below the age of 16, citing growing concerns over social media addiction and its impact on young minds.

title: NASA's Moon Mission Delayed Over Technical Issues, Rules Out March Launch
content: The highly anticipated Artemis 2 mission, lasting about 10 days, will see three Americans and one Canadian fly around Earth's satellite.

title: "You Are Already Naked": PM Modi Slams Congress' Shirtless Protest
content: A group of Youth Congress workers on Friday barged into a hall at the AI Summit, shirtless, shouting slogans against the government over agreeing to a trade deal with the US.

title: "My New Hero": Trump Praises US Top Court Judge For Supporting His Tariffs
content: After the Supreme Court decision, Trump made an unusually personal attack on the justices who ruled against him in a 6-3 vote, including two of those he appointed during his first term, Justices Neil Gorsuch and Amy Coney Barrett.

title: "Best Way To Predict Future Is To Invent It": What Entrepreneur Vishal Sikka Told NDTV
content: Vishal Sikka, founder and CEO of Vianai Systems, discussed the promises and perils of artificial intelligence. In an interview with NDTV's Senior Managing Editor Vishnu Som, the entrepreneur spoke of the need for careful oversight

title: LPG Explodes During Op To Control Fire At Delhi Home, Cops Among 13 Injured
content: An LPG cylinder exploded while fire and police personnel were trying to douse a house fire in northwest Delhi's Majlis Park on Sunday, leaving 13 injured, officials said.

title: Sabarimala Tantri's Bail Raises Questions: Did Investigation Lose Direction?
content: The Tantri was arrested by the Special Investigation Team probing alleged irregularities related to gold-plated encasings at the temple.

title: "Serious Lack Of Judgement": Academics On Youth Congress' AI Summit Protest
content: More than a hundred prominent academics from universities and research institutions across the country have issued a strongly worded joint statement, criticising the Indian Youth Congress protest at the India AI Impact Summit

title: 5 Live Cartridges Seized From IIT Bombay Hostel, Bihar Link Under Probe
content: Five live 7.65 mm cartridges were recovered from the bag of a student at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bombay in Powai during a security check inside the hostel premises, following a minor dispute over money between students

title: Indian Navy Intercepts Iranian Boat Off Gujarat, Seizes Rs 5 Crore Cigarettes
content: The Indian Coast Guard has intercepted a foreign boat in the Arabian Sea off Gujarat and apprehended four Iranian nationals after seizing 200 cartons of foreign brand cigarettes valued nearly Rs 5 crore, the ICG said on Sunday.

title: Why Hasn't US Made Arrests Over Epstein Links? UK Did With Ex-Prince Andrew
content: The stunning arrest of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor by UK police on suspicion of misconduct in public office must have chilled many powerful American men to the bone. They may now wonder: could something like this now happen in the US?

title: Boxing results: Ryan Garcia dominates Mario Barrios, wins first title
content: Ryan Garcia won the WBC welterweight championship with a unanimous decision . he dropped Mario Barrios in Round 1 with an overhand right and dominated the rest of the fight . barrios was making the fourth defense of his belt, losing to Rolando "Rolly" Romero .

title: With Mike Evans declining retirement, where do he and the Bucs stand?
content: he will return in 2026 . he suffered three broken vertebrae in his neck during a preseason game . the Bucs' all-time leading scorer was enduring one of the lowest and loneliest points of his life .

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S.' first-ever mass start medal, women's freeski halfpipe final postponed
content: The penultimate day at the Olympics felt like the calm before the storm. After Team USA women's ice hockey won gold against Canada in a thrilling match on Thursday, the American men followed up by advancing to the gold medal match by defeating Slovakia on Friday. They'll have a day off before facing Canada in the gold medal match Sunday, the last event of the 2026 Winter Olympics before the closing ceremony. That's not to say there was nothing happening on Saturday. Team USA women's curling fell short in a bronze medal match against Canada, and Mia Manganello won a bronze medal in the mass start, the U.S.'s first medal in that event. MORE:   Medal tracker  |  Full schedule of events  |  Olympics 101 Follow live with the best events from Saturday below.
